CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 17, 1955, pg. 16 reads: "Cabs Air-Conditioned - The Peoples Cab Company has acquired the first air-conditioned taxicabs in the United States and has ordered an entire new fleet of the new cabs. Shown inspecting the new cab are, left to right: W. Beverly Carter Jr., Courier publisher; Curtis Haines, director of public relations; Peoples Cab, and Adolph Fram, president, Peoples Cab. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: W. Beverly Carter Jr., Curtis Haines, and Adolph Fram, president of Peoples Cab, standing around People's taxicab inside garage, another version
